item.title: Extremely dangerous black ice along the whole roads, 2nd January
item.description:
Along northfield avenue and bournewood Road there is extremely dangerous black ice on roads and pavements. These are busy back roads which need to be gritted by the morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haydens Close, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flickering street lights from the grass side, 2nd January
item.description:
This is causing alot of issues whilst driving and also with anyone who is sensitive to flashing lights. The solar street lights are flickering from the start of the road till the end after sunset and it's from the grass side of the road. Can Peabody or Greenwich council please investigate and fix asap to avoid car accidents due to flashing lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldfinch Road, Plumstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop lights not working, 2nd January
item.description:
In thomes lane se6 4RQ bus stop Q as no lights on working on it this as been reported before to TFL but they didn’t hover to come and repair it can you get in touch with TFL and let them know about this TFL are getting lazy all the money they’re getting from the public to go into London is a con for the public
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Nelgarde Road, Ladywell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop no lights, 2nd January
item.description:
On Bromley road br1 4JU bus stop DC as no lights on it working it’s dangerous at night you can’t see who is coming up towards the bus stop when waiting for a bus you have to use your phone light so the driver can see you at the bus stop can you tell TFL that they need to repair this as been going on like this for four years TFL are starting to get lazy saying they don’t have the money all that money they’re getting from the public
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Bromley Hill, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gritting required, 2nd January
item.description:
Due to the snow the top of bluston parade and on to the footbridge is very slippery. There have been falls. This area is extra busy as the station Bridge is out of use. Please grit asap before someone breaks something.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 215-217, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Hemlock plant growing here last year, 2nd January
item.description:
In spite of the Greenwich Fix My Street website saying that this issue had been resolved, in fact the poisonous plant remained growing here until well into the autumn of 2025. The hemlock was beginning to set seed and was about to spread more widely, but at that point a resident of the street removed it (wearing protective gloves) and disposed of it in a black rubbish sack. Perhaps Fix My Street is not an effective place to report weeding issues.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mereworth Drive, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
